dashboard.control

Class CustomButtonGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • acm.graphics.GObject
      • acm.graphics.GCompound
        • dashboard.control.MouseWidget
          • dashboard.control.ButtonGrid
            • dashboard.control.CustomButtonGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    acm.graphics.GContainer, acm.graphics.GScalable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class CustomButtonGrid
extends ButtonGrid
    Implements a custom grid of Buttons that can be constructed at runtime. Pre-fabricated button grid widgets should subclass ButtonGrid instead of CustomButtonGrid.
    Author:
    Mark Sabini

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Builder for the CustomButtonGrid class.

    • Method Detail

      • addButton

        public boolean addButton(Button gb,
                         int row,
                         int col)
        Adds a button to the ButtonGrid at the specified row and column. The row and column are 0-indexed.
        Parameters:
        gb - the button to be added
        row - the row in which the button is to be placed
        col - the column in which the button is to be placed
        Returns:
        whether the button was successfully added

      • addButton

        public boolean addButton(Button gb,
                         int row,
                         int col,
                         int rowSpan,
                         int colSpan)
        Adds a button to the ButtonGrid at the specified row and column, spanning the specifed number of rows and columns. The row and column are 0-indexed.
        Parameters:
        gb - the button to be added
        row - the row in which the button is to be placed
        col - the column in which the button is to be placed
        rowSpan - how many rows the button should span
        colSpan - how many columns the button should span
        Returns:
        whether the button was successfully added

      • getButton

        public Button getButton(int row,
                        int col)
        Returns the button at the specified row and column.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the button to return
        col - the column of the button to return
        Returns:
        the button if it exists. If the button does not exist, the function returns null.
